data.event: The city was incorporated in 1956 and operates under the Council-Manager form of government, providing a full range of municipal services.

event.title: November 6, 1905, the Los Angeles Interurban Railway started

data.event: On November 6, 1905, the Los Angeles Interurban Railway started service on the Santa Ana Line.

event.title: allowed the population of the rural area which is now

data.event: Access to transportation allowed the population of the rural area which is now Stanton and West Anaheim to grow.

event.title: 1908, the privately owned Pacific Electric Railway leased

data.event: In 1908, the privately owned Pacific Electric Railway leased the Santa Ana Line and took over the service which extended its regional light-rail system.

event.title: 1928, the impressive thousand mile system allowed

data.event: By 1928, the impressive thousand mile system allowed residents convenient travel throughout Los Angeles and Orange Counties.
The passenger service to Santa Ana was discontinued in 1950, shortly after the railway was taken over by the Metropolitan Transportation Agency.
